metadata.name: Internal Install Helper System
metadata.author: Lizzie
metadata.purpose: Intelligent sync system for managing user features and workflows across team members and repositories

overview.description: A bidirectional sync system that keeps git workflow configurations consistent across: - User-level settings (~/.claude/settings.json) - Project-level settings (.claude/settings.json in each repo) - Multiple repositories - Multiple team members (independent contractors)

concept.name: Source of Truth
concept.definition: The user's ~/.claude/settings.json serves as the master configuration for all user features
concept.role: Lizzie is configured as the maintainer with isSourceOfTruth: true

concept.name: Sync Groups
concept.definition: Named collections of related commands, skills, and configurations that can be synced together

concept.name: Favorites
concept.definition: Sync groups marked as favorites are automatically added to new repositories
concept.behavior: When creating new features, favorites can be bundled automatically

concept.name: Worktree Strategy
concept.definition: Each repo uses a dedicated worktree for sync operations to isolate changes
concept.lifecycle: Created on-demand, can be cleaned up after merge

sync-flow.step: Developer updates ~/.claude/settings.json with new worktree command
Internal-Install-Helper detects change (via file watcher or on session start)
Agent asks: "Push to linked project repos?" with list of repos

Agent checks SSH configuration: - If SSH not configured: Automatically runs SSH setup (generate keys, display for GitHub) - If SSH configured but keys not added to GitHub: Shows public key and waits for user - If SSH fully configured: Proceeds immediately

For each repo: - Check if sync worktree exists, create if needed - Update files in sync worktree's .claude/settings.json - Update sync-manifest.json (version, changelog, timestamp, author) - Commit with attribution - Push branch to remote - AUTOMATICALLY create PR using gh CLI with detailed description
Agent confirms: "‚úÖ Pushed to N repos. PRs created:" with links
Team member pulls repo: git pull origin main
Agent compares checksums between project and user settings
If different: Show friendly notification with changes
User can: [OK - Do it!] [Show me what changed] [Skip for now]
If approved: - Create backup of ~/.claude/settings.json - Merge new commands into user settings - Update ~/.zshrc if needed - Confirm sync complete

ssh-setup.description: Automated SSH configuration for GitHub to enable agent-driven git operations

detection.check: Run: ssh -T git@github.com Success: Returns "Hi username! You've successfully authenticated" Failure: Returns "Permission denied (publickey)"
Run: git remote get-url origin Success: Starts with "git@github.com:" Failure: Starts with "https://github.com/"

automatic-setup-flow.step: Detect SSH status using checks above
If keys don't exist: - Generate SSH key pair: ssh-keygen -t ed25519 -C "user@repo-project" -f ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 -N "" - Display success: "SSH keys generated"

If keys exist but not added to GitHub: - Read public key: cat ~/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub - Display to user with instructions: "Please add this SSH key to GitHub:
Public Key: [key contents]
Steps: 1. Visit: https://github.com/settings/ssh/new 2. Title: [Repo Name] - Claude Code 3. Paste the key above 4. Click 'Add SSH key'
I'll test the connection when you're ready." - Wait for user confirmation - Test connection: ssh -T git@github.com

If git remote uses HTTPS: - Get current remote: git remote get-url origin - Convert to SSH format: Replace https://github.com/ with git@github.com: - Update remote: git remote set-url origin [ssh-url] - Confirm: "Git remote updated to use SSH"
Verify complete setup: - Test SSH: ssh -T git@github.com - If success: "SSH setup complete! Agent can now push automatically." - If failure: Show error and troubleshooting steps

issue.name: permission-denied
issue.solution: 1. Verify public key was added to GitHub account 2. Check key permissions: chmod 600 ~/.ssh/id_ed25519 3. Verify ssh-agent is running: eval "$(ssh-agent -s)" 4. Add key to agent: ssh-add ~/.ssh/id_ed25519

issue.name: wrong-key
issue.symptom: SSH connection works but for wrong GitHub account
issue.solution: 1. Check which key is being used: ssh -vT git@github.com 2. Create .ssh/config to specify key per host 3. Or remove old keys and re-add correct one

automatic-pr-flow.step: After pushing branch to remote, check if gh CLI is available: - Run: which gh - If not found: Prompt user to install: brew install gh

Create PR automatically with rich description: - Command: gh pr create --title "[title]" --body "[body]" - Title format: "sync: Update [group-name] v[version] by [author]" - Body format (use heredoc for multiline): ## Summary [Detailed summary of changes from changelog]

permission-system.description: Maintainer-only modification with unauthorized change detection and alerts

unauthorized-change-detection.trigger: When PR contains changes to protected files

detection.step: Check git commit author against allowedModifiers list
If author NOT in allowedModifiers: Flag as unauthorized
Parse changed files and identify protected files

alert-maintainer.message:
‚ö†Ô∏è UNAUTHORIZED CHANGE DETECTED
**Author**: {commit-author} **Files Modified**: {list-of-protected-files}
**Alert**: Only {maintainer-name} is authorized to modify these sync system files.
**Action Required**: 1. Review the proposed changes carefully 2. If changes are valid: Extract them and apply via your own commit 3. If changes are invalid: Reject the PR with explanation 4. Never merge PRs with unauthorized sync file changes directly
**Protected Files**: - .claude/sync-manifest.json - .claude/settings.json - .claude/skills/internal-install-helper.md - .claude/docs/INTERNAL-INSTALL-HELPER.xml
**Rationale**: These files control the sync system behavior across all team members. Unauthorized changes could: - Break the sync system - Introduce security vulnerabilities - Cause data loss in user settings - Create conflicts across multiple repos
@{maintainer-github-handle} - Review required

agent-instructions-for-detection.instruction: When reviewing PRs, ALWAYS check if protected files are modified
If protected files modified by non-maintainer: Post alert comment immediately
Set "needs-maintainer-review" label and request review from maintainer
Suggest to unauthorized author: "Please propose changes via issue for maintainer review"
